metadata.title: CVE-2017-7814 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
File downloads encoded with "blob:" and "data:" URL elements bypassednormal file download checks though the Phishing and Malware Protectionfeature and its block lists of suspicious sites and files. This would allowmalicious sites to lure users into downloading executables that wouldotherwise be detected as suspicious. This vulnerability affects Firefox <56, Firefox ESR < 52.4, and Thunderbird < 52.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7814` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0+build6-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
